description:
The redevelopment of that part of the site by the
erection of 61 residential units comprising twenty-five
1-bedroom flats  twenty  2-bedroom units and sixteen
3-bedroom houses together with the use of the southern
part of the site for commercial purposes  as shown on
drawing nos. SG.CR 100B  101B  102B  103A  104B  105D
106C  107B  108B  109B  110A  111A  112A  113A  114A
115A  117  118  119  120C  121.1A  121.2  122A  123  124
revised on 25.04.94 and 12.05.94.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The facing materials to be used on the buildings shall not
    be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and
    approved by the Council before any work on the site is
    commenced.

Condition : 2 - All new works to and works of making good to the existing
    boundary walls shall be carried out to match the original
    work as closely as possible in materials and detailed
    execution.

Condition : 3 - No pipes or plumbing, other than rainwater pipes, shall be
    fixed on the external face of the building.

Condition : 4 - The whole of the car parking accommodation shown on the
    drawings shall be provided and retained permanently for the
    parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the
    remainder of the building.

Condition : 5 - No development shall take place until full details of hard
    and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all unbuilt,
    open areas have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council.

Condition : 6 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to
    the end of the following planting season, with others of
    similar size and species, unless the Council gives written
    consent to any variation.
    a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved
    landscape details, prior to the occupation for the
    permitted use of the development or any phase of the
    development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of
    planting which, within a period of 5 years from the
    completion of the development die, are removed, or become
    seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as
    is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than

Condition : 7 - The details of the means of enclosure of the proposed roof
    terraces shall not be otherwise than as shall have been
    submitted to and approved by the Council before any work on
    the site is begun.

Condition : 8 - Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and
    Country Planning General Development Order 1988 (as
    amended) or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order,
    no development within Part 1 (Classes A to H) and Part 2
    (Classes A to C) of Schedule 2 of that Order shall be
    carried out without the grant of planning permission having
    first been obtained from the Council.

Condition : 9 - To ensure that the external appearance of the building will
    be satisfactory.
Condition : 10 - To safeguard the special character of the building.

Condition : 11 - Because it is considered that these would seriously detract
    from the appearance of the building.

Condition : 12 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion.

Condition : 13 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 14 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard
    of visual amenity in the scheme.

Condition : 15 - To ensure that the proposal does not result in loss of
    amenity to existing residents by way of everlooking.

Condition : 16 - To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to
    prevent over-development of the site by controlling
    proposed extensions and alterations.

Condition : 17 - The Council's Engineering Services should be consulted
    regarding the construction of the crossover on the public
    highway and any other work to, under, or over the public
    highway, including vaults and thresholds. The Section
    dealing with these matters is located at Camden Town Hall,
    Argyle Street entrance, Euston Road, WC1H 8EQ (071-278
    4444).

Condition : 18 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not
    take place other than between the hours of 8am to 6pm on
    Monday to Friday and 8am to 1pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.

Condition : 19 - Noise from demolition and construction works is subject to
    control under The Control of Pollution Act 1974. You are
    advised to consult the Council's Planning, Transport &
    Health Service, Pollution Team, Town Hall, Argyle Street
    entrance, Euston Road, WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 071-278 4444), or to
    seek prior approval under Section 61 if you anticipate any
    difficulty in carrying out construction other than within
    normal working hours and by means that would minimise
    disturbance to adjoining premises.

Condition : 20 - In good time prior to the start of construction (or, if
